page.title: 07Events.Britain in Bloom.
page.content: With the opening of the bypass in 1983 it was decided that something should be done to change the village and to try and make it more beautiful. A public meeting was called and a committee formed to enter the village in the{Britain in Bloom Competition}in 1984. Everyone worked hard to dig flower beds, plant trees,plants and shrubs.Soon everyone in the village was hard at work making their own gardens tidy, ready for the judging. The village really began to look much better and by the time the judges arrived there were lots of flowers in bloom. Everyone was delighted that the{Cup given by the{Newcastle Evening {Chronicle}for the most improved village was won by Scremerston, the only village in Berwick Borough to enter the competition.
